item.description:
Date changed to 12/16 to better accomodate participant schedules.

This is the last for the season of our bimonthly seminars on Bicycling Traffic Safety, taught by experienced members of the Portland Bicycle Commuting Meetup. This seminar will focus on knowledge and techniques to enable cyclists to ride safely and confidently with car traffic on public roads.

This month's seminar will be conducted by Ken O'Brien. When asked how long he's been riding, he says he never stopped from when he was a kid. Ken is a certified Effective Cycling instructor from the League of American Bicyclists (LAB), and brings to our Meetup much knowledge of bicycle safety issues along with a willingness to challenge our assumptions about them.

We will meet at Gorham Bike & Ski's new downtown location, 693 Congress Street. They have plenty off off-street car parking, for those who are unable to ride your bikes here. Check out their new digs!!
item.name: Traffic Safety Seminar
